description: Add a distinctive, funky pink footer to TaskFlow that breaks from the conventional design system, providing navigation links, branding, and a memorable visual identity with full responsive and dark mode support.

userStories.title: Pink Footer Component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a funky pink footer on every page so that the app has a distinctive brand identity and I can access navigation links from the bottom of the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A Footer component exists at src/components/ui/Footer.tsx using semantic <footer> HTML element
The footer is rendered at the bottom of every page via the root layout (layout.tsx)
The footer uses a bold pink color scheme (gradient from pink-400 to pink-600 or similar) that is visually distinct from the rest of the app
The footer includes at least one funky design element (wave/curved SVG top border, decorative pattern, playful typography, or CSS animation) with SVG decorative elements having aria-hidden='true'
The footer displays the TaskFlow brand name and copyright line (e.g. 'TaskFlow 2026')
The footer includes at least three navigation links (e.g. Home, About, Privacy) styled for legibility against the pink background with visible hover/focus states
On desktop (md+), footer content is laid out horizontally; on mobile (<md), content stacks vertically and is centered
Dark mode support: footer uses a darker/muted pink variant (e.g. dark:bg-pink-900) with legible text in both themes

userStories.title: Footer Social Media Icons
userStories.description: As a user, I want social media icons in the footer so that I can quickly navigate to TaskFlow's social profiles and stay connected with the community.
acceptanceCriteria: A row of at least four social media icons (GitHub, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Discord) is displayed in the footer
Each icon is an accessible <a> element with target='_blank', rel='noopener noreferrer', and a descriptive aria-label (e.g. 'Visit TaskFlow on GitHub')
Icons use inline SVG or an icon library and are sized consistently (24x24 or similar)
Icons have a white or light-pink default color with a scale or glow hover animation that fits the funky pink theme
On mobile (<md), the social icons row is centered and appears below the navigation links
Dark mode: icons remain visible and accessible with appropriate contrast against the dark pink background

userStories.title: Footer Newsletter Signup
userStories.description: As a user, I want a newsletter signup form in the footer so that I can subscribe to TaskFlow updates without leaving the current page.
acceptanceCriteria: A newsletter signup section is displayed in the footer with a heading (e.g. 'Stay in the loop')
The form contains an email input field with type='email', placeholder text, and a submit button
The input and button are styled to complement the pink theme (e.g. white input with pink-700 button or transparent border style)
Client-side validation shows an inline error message for empty or invalid email formats without a page reload
On successful submission, the form displays a confirmation message (e.g. 'Thanks for subscribing!') in place of the input
The form is keyboard-accessible: tab order is logical and the submit button has a visible focus ring
On mobile (<md), the newsletter section spans full width and stacks below the social icons
Dark mode: input and button maintain readable contrast and consistent styling

userStories.title: Footer Back-to-Top Button
userStories.description: As a user, I want a back-to-top button in the footer so that I can quickly scroll to the top of the page after reading through long content.
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Back to Top' button is displayed in the footer with an upward arrow icon and text label
Clicking the button smoothly scrolls the page to the top using smooth scroll behavior
The button is styled as a pill/rounded shape with a contrasting color (e.g. white or pink-200) against the pink footer background
The button has a hover animation (e.g. bounce, lift, or color shift) consistent with the funky theme
The button is accessible: it is a <button> element with aria-label='Scroll to top' and a visible focus ring
On mobile (<md), the button is centered and sized for easy tap targeting (min 44x44px)
Dark mode: button colors adjust to maintain visibility and contrast against the dark pink footer
